We have been using Perfect Service for a few years and the service was decent. However, I most recent service (duct cleaning) has us reconsidering to continue to use them. First, we were told the duct cleaning service would take about 4 hours to complete. The technicians that came out to complete the duct cleaning "completed" the service in 2 hours so we checked with them and asked if they completed the work in each room as they said they would when they first arrived. They said "yes, we did the work in all rooms." After they left, we double checked the rooms and saw that all room did not seem to be done because there was lint/matter still caked in the vents. I called Perfect Service about this issue and was told by Allen that he would have someone to come out a double check the ducts to make sure the work was indeed completed. No one returned my call so over the past 2-3 weeks I have been calling only to be transferred to a telephone line that one answers.

Second thing- when requesting the duct service work and getting a quote, Allen told us that we could finance our purchase. We provided the info (e.g., social security number) and quickly told him that we would rather pay the bill in cash, not have credit pulled. He was okay with that and told us the instructions for paying the guys who came out to complete the duct cleaning. To our surprise, my husband received a credit alert within minutes of Allen running his credit without his authorization despite us telling Allen we would pay in cash and Allen giving us instructions to pay in cash. I called Perfect Service after we realized what happened only to be told by Allen "I entered your social security number but didn't go to the next screen." A week or so later, a credit card from Wells Fargo arrived in the mail! Nothing could be done about Allen's mistake. Now my husband has a credit inquiry and credit card that he didn't ask for.

Our furnace decided to die on us just in time for winter to roll around, and since we were pretty unhappy with our previous HVAC techs decided to call around. We gathered several quotes, and Perfect Service wasn't the cheapest to the dollar - they were actually the second most affordable option we received. But for us, it was a no-brainier to choose Perfect Service and work with Kyle Kressig; there is so, so much value added to having a company you actually enjoy working with and having peace of mind knowing the work is done correctly. He was the friendliest rep we met with, the most polite, and the most professional. What sold me on Perfect Air was he offered me a whole spread of options we could choose from and each one was something we could actually use - there weren't any lowball or extravagant options - we actually had multiple choices that were all applicable to us! It was great, actually having some agency in what we could pick. Kyle worked out a fair deal for us in the end, and we even opted to add on a full duct cleaning service too. The duct cleaning is important to note, because he actually opened up our unit and did a full inspection, and found mildew growth that our previous company had absolutely failed to find despite us paying for them to come out twice a year for "seasonal inspections." We're both so happy we can, literally, breath a sigh of relief since we have a toddler at home. Install was lightning fast, and so considerate of noise that our toddler actually napped through the entire installation despite his room being directly above the work. It was genuinely cleaner down there when they were done, too, which is always a nice bonus.

We're fully on board to have Kyle and Perfect Service be our go-to HVAC company moving forward. I sincerely wish we had found them years ago when we bought the house, instead of just going along with what the previous owners had used. Big thanks to Kyle.

Do not use this company. Charlie, the owner, is rude and unprofessional. I have a home warranty company that called them to my home to fix some ducts that fell and were cooling my crawl space instead of my home. They are 56 years old. It's bound to happen. Well, because I had cable installed three months ago, Charlie told them that the cable guy must have knocked the ducts loose and that's why they fell. This is a flat out lie. You cannot prove that someone knocked them down unless you saw them do it. Believe me I would have called a long time ago if that was the case.There is other duct work that has fallen nowhere near where the cables were installed, but those won't be covered either because it's all the same system.  The ducts fell only in the last week or so. Charlie was never at my home to do the inspection and the person who was at my home said that it was due to old age. But because Charlie said otherwise only looking at pictures, my home warranty company will not be covering the cost. Now I will have to hire someone on my own, and you bet it will not be One Call. Not to mention their prices are much higher than most anyway.

Brian was Awesome! He did what others couldn't at nearly half the cost.We had problems heating our upstairs for years. Each year we would call a different company that over promised and under delivered. One company suggested adding an additional air duct which we did but did'nt solve the problem. Another company recommended installing an additional return duct. We did but saw little improvement. Another company suggested adding dampers and a ceiling fan which we did, but it still didn't work.

Finally we said as much as we have spent over the years we would invest in a new unit. Most companies wanted to add two units to our house or one and a mini-split. Brian suggested adding an air duct in the place where all other companies said it couldn't be done and just replace the one unit with a 14 SEER unit. He also mentioned there was no need for the dampers because we already had adjustable vents. He installed the air duct and new unit in 3 hours and our upstairs feels just as good as the rest of the house. Brian was very professional, punctual and polite. I highly recommend Peak Performance!

Horrible experience.  I called about a clogged kitchen sink and had a 1430 appointment scheduled for Friday. I called 30-45 minutes after the appointment because the repairman had not shown up or called.  He ended up being over 3 hours late.  He spent a little over an hour snaking and plunging the sink (both things that I told him I had been doing repeatedly the last 24-48 hours). He didn’t have anything fixed, charged $175 and we scheduled another appointment for Sunday at 0700.  This time he was over 4 hours late. He spent the first hour and a half doing the exact same two things he did on Friday that didn’t work.  He then needlessly cut the pipe under the sink that he had already disconnected in order to snake it and had to go get materials to repair it.  He was gone for an hour.  He repaired it after coming back and then went into the attic to try and snake the clog from another direction.  He said he was going to use a drain bladder to try and clear the clog and would need a 100’ hose, which I had and offered.  He instead left again for well over an hour.  He came back with a brand-new garden hose and bladder and had the clog cleared in about 15 minutes.  I was charged another $750 because he was there for “5 hours”.  This job could have been completed in a fraction of the time, but I guess when you’re charging by the hour, even the hours you aren’t actually at my home, you take your sweet time and try to look busy.

I can’t speak to their other services, but if you have a plumbing issue, save your money, and sanity, and hire someone else.

I don't normally post reviews, but I think these gentlemen received a shout-out. They were timely, called beforehand, they were nice and did a good job working all afternoon in the heat to get our unit installed. But I especially want to praise the way they handled the snake that was in the crawl space with them lol. It wasn't poisonous, but they insisted it be gone before they continued working haha, which I understand, since it was right above their heads. But instead of refusing to work or freaking out and killing it, they gently removed it with my pitchfork and took it to the woods near my house (where I am sure it patiently waited for them to leave so she could come back). They handled it so well, laughing and joking around, and I am very grateful they were okay with just temporarily removing her. I really appreciated them not taking her life unnecessarily or insisting I remove it myself before they continued. Because while I don't mind snakes being around, I was not excited about the prospect of trying to remove it. Anyways, they got right back to work in there, knowing there could be others, and knowing the one they had removed was probably trying to make it's way back!

Feb 19 2024, check out AC/heating. Very professional and honest. Thanks. Joseph

reviews.text:
I’m a landscape contracting company that needed service very quickly. I cannot say enough about how impressed I am with this company. My regular plumber could not help us with a problem we had on the commercial job. My contact on this project recommended Stegall Plumbing as they have done work on this building before. I called the same day and they said the technician would call me between 12 o’clock and 1 o’clock. He called me at 12:45 PM and said he’d be on site in about 15 minutes. They got a very simple problem solved for me in about 10 to 15 minutes. Very impressed with their professionalism and ease of service. I would highly recommend them and definitely i’m
gonna use them in the future!

I called Stegall today immediately when I noticed my heater had stopped working in todays 17 degree weather. They were so responsive to my needs and came quickly!  My heater was repaired just in time for tonight’s 11 degree weather!  Always so professional and courteous, the best. Would never use any other company!!

I recently used Stegall Heating, Air and Plumbing for a routine HVAC maintenance check and was thoroughly impressed with their professionalism and expertise. The technician, Justin, was punctual, polite, professional, and most importantly, competent in servicing our systems. I signed up for the pm service agreement because I’m confident that they will be able to continue to provide that same level of service and standard of care.

My AC failed on a hot August evening and I was looking to make a change from another Carrier dealer. Was able to talk to a tech (Justin) after hours who was helpful. Decided to wait till next morning and called before they opened. Was able to talk with a real person who could say they could schedule me around lunch that day (again, this is before they even opened). Joe called and was enroute by about 10:30 AM. Diagnosed a bad capacitor immediately, had the part on the truck and was done in no time. Also courteous and friendly. Price was reasonable and solved the problem. I plan to use Steagall for my Carrier systems in the future.

Outstanding service, great company, dependable and reliable, a company you can trust!

I am an absentee store owner and whenever I have any issues with my HVAC system, I call Stegall!  I have been using Stegall as my HVAC experts since 2013. They respond quickly and meet my needs each time I call!  They provide excellent HVAC service, repair and replacement.  Their entire staff are very professional and a pleasure to work with!  Brent is an outstanding technician who have provided me with reports and great recommendations to my issues. Their rates are also very good!

I highly recommend Stegall as my success is dependent on their service and reliability!
I called Stegall after business hours, and Joe was at my house within an hour. Joe was quick to fix my HVAC and very responsive to all my questions. He was a pleasure to work with.

We have used Stegall for years and have never been disappointed in their service or technicians.  Steven K came and made sure our AC was functioning properly, as we had guests. Very professional and friendly, just like all the technicians we’ve known from Stegall.

If you're looking for a great company to service your home Stegall is the one you should trust. They have been my HVAC company for several years after providing prompt and honest service. The staff has always been very helpful with explaining different options. I highly recommend them.

I will never use company again. They advise they will service an area one day then advise they don’t another. This is crazy when they have already come out once to do work. This is even more  frustrating when they don’t call back. Customer service is lacking.
Joe Rider did I great job troubleshooting and fixing the problem I had with my furnace. Thanks
Absolutely incredible work by these guys

Joe Rider with Stegall has been doing our services for years! He is always very thorough and does a great job. Extremely nice guy and very helpful with any questions or information we need to know to keep our unit running well.

I used another HVAC company to do a "$49 cleaning" and was told one of my units was "dangerous"-  I called Stegall (initially installed systems) for a second opinion.  Joe came out and did a thorough inspection of both systems and everything checked out fine.  Had I listened to other company....I would be $15k poorer-  I've had multiple great experiences with Stegall and will continue to recommend them.  Thanks Joe and Stegall!
Called about some electrical work and they came out same day. Mr. Penn was extremely knowledge, and very polite.

Adam and his co-worker were pleasant and professional. Considering it’s the holiday season. We had a lot happening in my home and I forgot to move some items for them to work before they arrived to the house. They installed 2 new faucets,  2 toilets and cleaned up after themselves. Thank you guys for doing such a good job. Always use Stegall for their great service they have provided me through the years. 👍🏼😊

Excellent Company !!! Owner is a stand-up guy. Honest. Reliable. Affordable.

We’ve been using Stegall for years with great results! They’re friendly, professional, reliable and always seem to have someone available within a day or so - like Joe Rider! Super polite, very knowledgeable, on time and fast! He’s also very respectful of our home, privacy and pets. We HIGHLY recommend him!
Joe Rider is very knowledgeable and took the time to explain our options!
Very pleased with the service. Joe Ryder has serviced my A/C unit on several occasions and he has always been prompt and very professional!
Joe Rider was an excellent technician. He was professional,knowledgeable and very polite.

Joe came out and assisted with an issue our A/C system was having. He was incredibly cordial, helpful and fixed the issue.

Joe and Steven we on time and very profesh. Great company!

John came out and arrived exactly when they estimated he would. He diagnosed my issue, found a solution better than what I had “googled”, and had my problem fixed within 50 minutes. This was my first time using Stegall, but I’ll definitely call them moving forward.

I find Steagall and it’s employees to be knowledgeable and prompt and professional from the administrative side to the service side.

Great company, repairs on our HVAC were reasonably priced.  The service professional that came to our house, Joe Rider, did a great job getting our system back in tip top shape and was prompt and courteos!

Stegall has been our go-to for Plumbing, Electrical & HVAC. We have an older home, so the guys at Stegall help us give it a little TLC. Brandon Jones especially will go the extra mile! Thank you guys!

My two HVAC units were due for annual spring service, and my commercial ice maker had stopped running .  Upon my request, Ken Speer called before his arrival, and promptly arrived on time. Very professional and friendly, Ken immediately began to perform the maintenance service due on my units.

I knew my upstairs heat pump system was in need of replacement, and Ken explained the problems with it, and recommended a replacement system that would be best suited for the space.

Ken determined the problem with my ice machine, installed the replacement part needed, and had my machine making ice, in less than an hour.

I mentioned to Ken, the water pressure in my house had never been sufficient, since I built my house in 2005, and he contacted a co-worker from Stegall's plumbing division, and upon his prompt arrival, they determined my pressure regulator needed replacing.  Stegall had the replacement part on their truck.  The new regulator was quickly installed, the pressure adjusted, and my water pressure problems were solved throughout my entire house, for the first time, since I built my house, 11 years ago.

I would highly recommend Stegall's services to anyone in need of HVAC, or plumbing service.  Ken Speer is a professional, knows his business, and promptly resolved 3 major issues within my home, and did so, in just a few hours.  I couldn't be happier with his customer service.  I give him an A+.

Our A/C went out last night and Joe was here first thing this morning and had it fixed before we could even blink. He identified the problem, replaced the motor and now we're in the cool again. I can't thank Joe enough for helping us out in such a timely fashion. Thank you Joe!!!

I'm very pleased with the services I have received with Stegall. Great company, great staff.

reviews.text:
Once again they prove their the best.
With their check in system, they confirm the date and time . Then there's the profiles sent  on the tech so I knew Mark coming out and he was there on time. Checked the system out, left no mess behind.   What a great company.!!

I remain blown away by the positive experience I had with Daniel and team at Temperature Pro. Our 3ton 2005 HVAC system had died and we needed a full replacement. We had also noticed hot and cool spots on the  upstairs floor serviced by the system. Daniel conducted a thorough inspection of the old system and our duct work, then provided a clear explanation of the various issues followed by highly detailed estimates for replacing the old system. He patiently answered myriad questions, including a couple that required a bit of research. He provided a second set of estimates for a different system to help us stay within budget. He made sure replacements were Energy Star and offered excellent warranties and financing w/Greensky. He was able to schedule the installation when we needed it and his team were on time, professional, and cleaned up when they were finished! Communication with the office staff was also professional and prompt. Daniel and the others at TempPro earned our trust and we will be hiring them for biannual maintenance and any future HVAC repairs/installations. A-plus on BBB and glowing reviews of Daniel on Google are well-deserved.
Great service and arrived on time. They were very thorough and expedient. Will definitely use them again.

Mark did a great job reviewing the unit and assessed the issue well. Alan and Jaylon followed up by being very professional, personable, and displayed great knowledge of HVAC solutions. And Brooklyn was a great office manager who efficiently provided scheduling and overall assistance on the phone. Would recommend and use this company for all my HVAC needs.  Impressed with the service.

UPDATE:
So I got a call from Grissom Brother's on yesterday. The customer service rep expressed the company's concern with my customer service experience. Apparently I was overcharged. I should not have been charged the diagnostic fee once I accepted service. She also explained that I received the best product for my situation and that the price was on par with receiving quality product and labor. She surprisingly rectified the situation by giving me a huge discount for my trouble instead of just refunding the diagnostic fee. I really appreciated that! 😊

I must say, superior customer service, as I received from Grissom Brother's on yesterday is priceless! Based on their integrity alone,  I'd not only highly recommend them but use them again.

ORIGINAL POST:
So I just had the capacitor on my AC unit fixed. It took the guy at most 15 minutes to fix. The cost was about $355 plus the $85 diagnostic fee. This is a bit pricy for not even 30 minutes worth of work with a part that is not that expensive. Online research revealed that an appropriate price for this work is between $100 and $150, if you choose not to do it yourself. And if that's not enough, it's extra to use a credit card. Wow!!!

I guess I shouldn't have been trying to get the air fixed so fast and through the warranty; which didn't help because the part wasn't even covered. And since it was going to cost me $85 anyway, I went ahead with the service...big mistake 😕. I mean, the dude showed me a price list on his phone; I should have known something since he didn't have an actual one to show me...smh. This is the first time reviews let me down. One of their customers gets an $11,000 quote from a competitor but the problem is fixed for less than $100 by them. Guess that wasn't a real review "fake news". 🤔🤨🙄☹️😒

On a positive note, although the technician spelled my name completely wrong on the invoice, he was nice, fast talking and moving but nice.

We called Wilbur’s the morning that our sink backed up.  The receptionist was prompt and efficient.  She asked their scheduler to call us to set up a time for service.  We were very pleased that they could send someone the same day to fix our problem.  Will Doonan arrived in the mid afternoon. He assessed our problem issues and advised us of the cost of the service up-front.  We agreed and he began working to resolve our issues.  In the course of his work, he also discovered that the regulator and the shut-off valve were worn out and needed to be replaced.  We had previously  been aware of the regulator issue, but had been putting off fixing it.  We asked for an estimate of the cost and his price was less than previous estimates that we had received.  We agreed to have this repair added to our work order.
Will worked efficiently, professionally, and meticulously.  He came equipped with all of the parts needed to make our repairs.  He worked for several hours, taking real pride in getting the job done right.  We were very pleased with the job he did for us.  I also want to say that the work he did to replace the regulator and the broken outdoor faucet was so meticulous.  He had to drill a hole in the wall to fit the new parts, but he took extra time and effort to completely seal the areas where the hole had been.  Replacing the regulator has made showering a new experience!  The water pressure is the best we have had in 30+ years of living here.  I highly recommend Wilber’s Air Conditioning, Heating and Plumbing!  They do quality work at reasonable prices!

We moved into this house 4 years ago (built in ‘90) and knew the HVAC units were old with some parts being from the original build. Our ductwork was full of mold and our electric bill was through the roof. We knew it was finally time to replace them and had four different companies come out and give estimates. We were the most impressed with Daniel at Plus One. They pointed out where our original install was designed improperly and completely redid both our upstairs and downstairs systems including all new duct work. We also felt like their pricing was more reasonable than some other companies we received quotes from.

The new systems are very nice and we now have a dual fuel heat pump for both floors of the house. Gadge and Myles did most of the install work and we couldn’t have been happier with their work. They did a great install and were very professional and hardworking whenever they were here.

If you are looking for a company and are not sure who to choose because every company is giving you different answers on what your home needs I recommend going with Plus One. They take a scientific approach to ensuring all of your ductwork is sized correctly for proper airflow. They installed dampers and adjusted the airflow in each room to meet the needs of the space. Most of this stuff other companies didn’t offer to do.

The new system works more efficiently and is quieter than our old system. We also had the AprilAire whole home air cleaner installed to help with our allergies. The ductwork was really well done and passed pressure testing with flying colors. Our old ductwork was really leaky and had so many holes in it. This new ductwork is made from sheet metal wrapped in insulation and will last for decades.

They customized the install to meet our home’s specific needs and didn’t insist on one size fits all. We will continue to use Plus One to service our new systems for life. We had a great experience with everyone we dealt with at Plus One. They definitely earned a five star review.

it's also been my long-time dream to live in a house with a fireplace, and last summer Court came out in the middle of August and September heat to install a gas line and top-quality gas fireplace for me in my previously cosmetic fireplace. Even though it doesn't get that cold here in the winters, I have thoroughly enjoyed it every time I've used it and have had zero issues with either warmth or functionality from the fireplace installation. It's unbelievably cozy!

Finally, at the beginning of this summer, my AC unit finally gave up the permanent ghost, and aside from a minor dispatch issue where my call was not relayed until a few days later, once he knew of my issue Court immediately came out, quoted me a price $1,000 less than the competition wanted, and very clearly and honestly explained all of my choices on units before helping me make a choice and installing my new AC unit and furnace. He was here the next morning before 8 and worked all day to get me up and running so that by the time I got home from work that evening I finally had cold air blowing again. When he had to take down some existing shelves in my garage to fit the new (proper) unit configuration, he even carefully reshaped and rebuilt them after he was finished AND replaced all of my paint cans and tools on them exactly as they had been, which is above and beyond the call of any HVAC contractor I've worked with in the past. He also fixed a ton of poor ancient wiring and jerry-rigged electrical systems in the process, and he checked with me multiple times to make sure I was completely satisfied before calling the job finished and asking for even a single cent.

I have been so pleased with every aspect of working with Court and Cool Breeze. His team has always been punctual, professional, and very honest about what did and did not need to be fixed, and I'm typing this review from the comfort of a very chilly house thanks to the AC he's had up and running for me since June. :) I would wholeheartedly recommend Cool Breeze to anyone who needs HVAC assistance.
Court is awesome!!!

We can't say enough positive things about Court and Cool Breeze!  Court gave us several options to consider after evaluating our HVAC needs based on the size and location of our house at Lake Martin.  We chose the highest efficiency unit because of the mfg reputation, long term warranty on both the unit and repair cost and his familiarity with other comparable products.  Court made 1 trip to assess specific structural and ducting needs at our location and then returned at the agreed upon date and installed the unit.  This was a time consuming effort and they stayed over 12 hours to make sure we would have air that night. He also left our basement cleaner then it was.  Since then we have also had Cool Breeze install a dehumidifier.  There was 1 minor problem that required replacement of the interactive thermostat which was quickly addressed.  We will definitely continue to recommend them and use them for all our HVAC needs!!!

Have had many properties over the years and dealt with many HVAC contractors.  Court and the Cool Breeze Team have the Best Service, The Best Equipment and he will tell you what the other guys won't.  Don't trust your HVAC repairs and replacements to just anyone, trust Court and Cool Breeze.

Today, November 30, 2024, Kashun came to check my system for the heat fan not working. He quickly discovered a blown fuse on the system, replaced it, and got the fan running again. Took less than 20 minutes, but made a huge difference for the comfort of our house.

Regarding the previous post on November 30, 2024, the fan ran less than 2 hours before going off again. I called Freedom repeatedly throughout the day Sunday when there announcement says their hours are 8-5. I never even got the courtesy of a call. Finally, Monday morning Kashun returned with Justin and they determined the system needed a new control board, which they installed. They said I would have "regular" heat overnight and they would be back Monday morning. Monday at 10:00, Michael Swann arrived. He spent 2 hours and found that the problem was occurring in the "plug" when the heat pump attempted to turn on the gas supplemental heat. I'm not sure what he did, but he assured me he had turned that switch on and off multiple times and it worked. He told me to monitor the system overnight to be sure the fan was turning on and off. It is now 2 days later and the system is working as expected. Thank you, Michael! Shame on Freedom for lack of communication and response on the weekend.

I reached out to Freedom when my HVAC unit (which they installed for the previous homeowner) began to decline over Labor Day weekend. Of course, I was quoted that I needed to install a "brand new" unit to the tune of $14K that I am currently financing through their recommended service, although other companies I quoted afterward were not nearly this much. Install happened, and things were fine for about a week before I began noticing pooling water in my air intake and water damage on my bedroom and closet ceiling. The same guys who initially installed the unit came to fix the leak, and mentioned that someone would contact me about the water damage (which no one ever did).

Cut to this past weekend when I went to turn on the heat for the very first time on this brand new unit, and nothing is working. Air isn't heating and the unit won't kick off on "auto." I had an appointment scheduled from 10-12, and the technician (really nice guy, all things considered) finally showed up at approximately 4 p.m. After working around on the outside unit, attic unit, and thermostat, I was essentially told he didn't know why it wasn't heating or why things were set up the way they were, and that they'd need to order a part to see if that would fix it. I was given no timeline of when that part would come in other than "sometime next week," even though we're sitting here with 20 degree nights happening. I've called twice today to try and get some clarity, but keep getting sent to voicemail. Frustrated doesn't even begin to describe this experience.

I texted JC's Heating and Cooling, expecting I would hear back from them on Monday, but Chad responded almost immediately and come over Saturday morning. I can not imagine what I would have done if I had not been a client of JC's for the past 7 years.  They have serviced my HVAC system since we moved here, so they know the condition of the unit.

At approximately 9:45pm on a Thursday evening I heard a loud noise outside my house and the power blinked a couple of times. After checking outside I went throught the house checking appliances making sure everything was working. The upstairs AC had stopped cooling and would not come on. I called JC's Heating and Cooling and left a message for a service call.  They called me back the first thing Friday said they would be here before noon. Upon arrival their technician checked all of the equipment both inside and out. Within 20 minutes the diagnosis was made that a power surge had knocked out the main motor in the air handling system. On Monday they were back with a new motor and the system was back cooling the house. A welcome relief since the heat outside is in the 90s and the humidity is almost 60%.
Thanks JC's!

I've been a customer for 30+  years now.  As always, they are prompt, efficient, and so pleasant.  They keep my system serviced,  and  quickly handle any problem  that might arise.  JC'S  is more than a business...... they are friends.

System was installed by someone I know from out of town and didn’t have time to get back to look at it. They came and looked at it, spent all of 5-10 minutes, charged me $149 and then it felt like I was being ghosted. Couldn’t get a response until a had called about 10 times in one day and even then they had no resolution to the problem. After going through 3 other companies to no avail over 3 months of chasing issues, we decided to call around and wipe the slate clean with a new system plus the addition of a Halo 6 whole home filtration system to stop the Alabaster lime, the calcium and removal of all chlorine from the water.

Standard was the only company to call me back after calling countless others once we realized we were not going to get hot water again out of the old unit. Mike was our Technician and was simply fantastic. He made the case for what we now have from them and we went all in on it and couldn’t be happier. He was top notch and knows his stuff. Standard even rearranged some things to get me up and going sooner than anticipated. Best money I could have spent. All around great experience from those who answer the phones all the way to Mike!

I got a call from dispatch shortly after 7 AM  the next day and we scheduled a tech to come out between 8 and 8:30. At 8 sharp the tech arrived and it was Landon who I had talked to the night before. My wife is in a wheelchair and has Parkinson's so it was very important to us to restore service. After 1-1/2 hours, Landon identified the problem and made the necessary repairs!

Technician arrived on time and correctly assessed that my air conditioner problem was a dead capacitor. After replacing it, he noticed that the air still wasn't cooling as well as it could have, so he checked the refrigerant level.
This is where things took a turn.
Technician told me that the system was low on refrigerant.
Okay, let's add some.
No can do. Your system runs on R22, which is outlawed.
Is there a replacement?
Yeah.
Well let's put that in.
I can't mix them.
Can you flush the old refrigerant and replace it with the new?
Well, that's $1500.
So what are you telling me?
There's nothing we can do. Your unit is old (2009) and at the end of its life. I can give you some estimates for new one.
After this, the technician sat at my table at proposed three different options ranging from #$11,000 to $20,000 dollars for a 2.5 ton unit. When I expressed a desire to fix what I've already got, he tried to talk me out of it.
You must work on commission, I said.
No, it doesn't matter to me one way or the other, he said.
It didn't sit right with me, so I said I'd think about it and after the technician left, I called three other AC repair businesses who all refuted what the Ethridge technician told me.
I had one of them come out and look at the unit for a second opinion. I was told that 1) my unit was just slightly low on coolant and not nearly as low as I'd been led to believe, and that 2) R22 substitute refrigerants are widely available and a unit can be filled for just a few hundred dollars. In fact, you can buy a 25 pound supply that will last many years for $400.
Furthermore, the technician I called for a second opinion spent two hours looking for things that could be wrong with my unit and found nothing at all. I was told that the unit is performing as well as it can for a 15 year old system and that in this extreme heat (upper 90s) I shouldn't expect it to cool much better than it already is and that even his own home unit wasn't able to cool much better than mine during this time of year.
This review is a long time coming. I've been using Ethridge for years, and their technicians have been telling me my units are on their last legs for the better part of decade, but they're still trucking along. The unfortunate truth is, Ethridge technicians would rather lie about your AC problems to convince you to buy a new one (for a cool $20,000) than fix what you've already got.
I wish it wasn't true, but the proof is in the pudding.

Called the office and apparently the girl I originally spoke with, hadn't scheduled me. I'm sure it was simply accidental. They were then going to call the techs and I should have been seeing them soon.
2 hours later, still no contact, nothing. I called the office, again. This is when it started to change. The lady I spoke with, Tonya, now knew the entire situation and was going to get this fixed.
She called me back and let me know the technician was finishing one, I'd just been added to his schedule and would be on the way.
Benjamin White was who showed up and I'm incredibly thankful. His kindness and his positive attitude almost made me forget I'd been waiting all day. He had never been given the order. He got it at 4 in the afternoon. The office staffed dropped the ball, not the technician. He came in, accessed the situation, explained it to me, fixed it, and even discounted my price because of the day's events. It's unusual to have GREAT customer experience these days, as sad as that is, but HE was great. Again, kindness, understanding, positivity. If someone had come in with a terrible attitude, after waiting all day, this review would be much different!!

My husband and I returned from a trip to find a very expensive water bill and what ended up being a leak from our waterline. It seems we have made a mistake with calling Xcalibur. While the workers were polite and friendly the pricing was outrageous.

They quoted us at $7,000 to put in a new water line!! Even we knew that was an outlandish price. My husband refused and asked for $5,500 since we knew a friend had one done for $3,850 with CJ plumbing and another family friend had one done for $4,300. They would not be competitive and get within 1.5k of another local company (they came down to $6,300). The managers response: “We are not the cheapest option.” We weren’t asking for that, but we were asking for them to be competitive. Sadly, they aren’t even that.

Upon further review of the project, they did a poor job with cleanup/aesthetics. The water line may be quality work but their follow through of presentation and cleaning isn’t. Picture and video show how much they destroyed our yard and left mud, broken bricks and small trench in our mulch bed. The last picture is of our friend’s yard after he paid $2,450 less with CJ plumbing to have his done (same issue- waterline leak, new line replacement). Which looks better? Which price would you rather pay? Call someone else, save money and have a better-looking yard & mulch bed.

ADDITIONALLY: I would be highly skeptical of the owners’ responses to negative reviews here.  He responded to my husband’s saying he would call him on Monday. Not only did he not call on the following Monday, but my husband left a message for him on Tuesday, Thursday and Friday. Still no returned call.

The employees were polite, respectful and the work so far seems to be satisfactory. Unfortunately, their price is outrageous.

To directly quote the manager I spoke with: “we are not the cheapest option.” I was not expecting them to be the cheapest, but I was expecting them to be competitive – sadly they were not even that. If their pricing was competitive, I would have given 4 or 5 stars. Their commercials harp on quality and how important quality work is. I am all for that and here for it! However, what they don’t say is that they clearly believe you must sacrifice affordability for quality. And that is simply not true. I gave them a try because the owner was a former Marine, and my dad was an officer for 27 years with the Corps. I really wanted to like them but will not be using them again and will be telling neighbors and friends to steer clear as well.

To give you specifics, they initially quoted me at OVER 7k to put a water line in. I refused that and they came down to $6,300. A friend of mine got the same exact thing done with CJ plumbing in Birmingham for just $3,850 (I can prove with receipt and pictures). Another family friend had theirs done for $4,300 with a different company. I have used Eagle Plumbing and On Time service in the past and their work has been quality AND affordable, I will be returning to them (and trying CJ’s) for my plumbing, electrical, & AC needs. Don’t waste your time with this company or you will drastically overpay. I should have just gone an extra day without water and called a different company to come out and saved significant money. Don’t make the mistake I made.

REPLY TO OWNER BELOW:
The owner never called on Monday. I called on Tuesday and left a message for him which the secretary said she gave to him. Did not receive a call back on Tuesday.  Have now called again on Thursday and left another message.

Paradise Heating and Air did a phenomenal job at our house and saved us tons of money. We had a few issues going on including excess dust, high humidity, and a major temp split between upstairs and downstairs due to being on a single system.

Jonathan was quick to come out for an assessment and quote. He provided multiple options to fit our needs and budget. There was no pressure from him when it came to us deciding on the right option. He simply educated us on what needed to be done and the pros and cons to each option.

The majority of the ductwork was removed including the trunks that were duct board. The trunks were replaced with 12” metal duct and insulated. Two additional trunks of the same size were added. Two trunk lines are dedicated to the downstairs and the other two for the upstairs. Each trunk has an electronic damper that actuates more open or more closed as air is needed between the zones. A zone control board was installed to manage the dampers. An additional thermostat was installed for the upstairs portion of the house.

Since this work has been done, we haven’t seen any dust particles floating around the house like before. Our humidity levels went from being in the high 70’s to the mid 40’s. We have ran a dehumidifier constantly over the years that would need to be emptied multiple times a day. It’s been over a week since this work was completed and we haven’t had to empty the dehumidifier once!! The temperature split between floors is nonexistent. Simply set the upstairs to a temp and the downstairs to a temp and the system works flawlessly. Perfect for us having a nursery upstairs set at 70° and our bedroom downstairs set at 68°.

Paradise Heating and Air is by far the best around. Great pricing, accurate assessments on what needs to be done, and scheduling is a breeze. Do yourself a favor and call them anytime you need anything HVAC related!!!! Thank you, Jonathan and the whole team at Paradise Heating and Air for everything y’all did for us. It honestly feels like a completely new home to us.

This review is from earlier this year***These people are super nice- from original phone contact to service appointment- BUT I was contacted via phone for a "service special" to have HVAC units cleaned-  I figured I'd have the units cleaned, they would tell me something was wrong (just business stuff) and I'd move on-  First guy was here for hours- then a supervisor showed up...with a tool that was needed-  by 7pm (after hours of being here)  I was told that my downstairs furnace was defective and that while the house might not explode, it was very dangerous-  Claimed it needed to be replaced immediately and was ready to start tearing it out immediately-  BOTH AC units had leaks (AC was never turned on/off to do testing- I have had this done before and knew it had to be done a certain way), the outside units couldn't be cleaned as they were so bad and even had a huge ant bed built in the unit (you can see over in the units-  no real debris and no ant bed).  A long story - but ending was I could choose one of three different systems from $10,000-15,000 (one system said to be defective ), cash was King, "just point to the price that you need (felt like a used car sale)-  I explained I would not be making a decisions that night- a couple of times and they left-  I called the company who installed the systems the very next morning- and they came out-  I covered the company name on the notes left for me (trying to be fair to Perfect Service) and let the Technician see what the issues were-  He really ignored the notes and did his own inspection- NOTHING was found wrong- showed me the "defective area" and it's built that way- not defective.  Checked for Freon leaks (turned units off/on etc)- nothing-  said he'd be happy to clean the outside units but they weren't very dirty- This company could have told me the same thing or even a smaller problem to be fixed (to incur extra fees/charges)-  there was NO problem with either unit-  NOTHING-  so from you need $15,000 worth of equipment/service to absolutely no issues?  I never heard back from Perfect Service - with the level of concern and possibility  of a large sell, you'd think they would have followed up- Again- super nice folks but I read other reviews that were similar, confirmed same sort of "Sales job" and even talked with another client locally who thinks the company might have intentionally created the issue they ended up paying $4,000 to fix-  I never (hardly ever) do reviews- and never a negative review- but this was such an amazing experience that it really needs to be part of their review and let other now so they can make their own decisions- I'd also note that I had cameras with audio recording so some of this can't be denied- *******UPDATE-  I have spoken with Landon and addressed the issues I had-  He has offered to refund the money paid for original scheduled service and listened/responded to my complaints.  I have some hope that being willing to discuss the issues might result in improvements-

Customer of Centerpoint Alabama.  I just want to Recognize Jake from ( Perfect Service  ) for always keeping my unit up to code for comfort.
Eventhough, I wasn't home at the time of the service.  I was able to look at my camera and see the entire service being done and the temperature at the time was climbing.  Yet he did his job and gave me and my family  a "Perfect Service"....

Normally would not put anything bad up about a company, BUT these folks deserve it, royally.  Jay and their team have worked on my system since they acquired KS Services a couple years ago and since they have been extremely difficult to even get over to the house to do work.  When they do come, all you hear about is how bad everything is and recommend things that don’t make since.  They installed dampers for zones that don’t work at all, installed ducts that don’t need to be there and when I asked them to remove them they just taped up the hole they made and left the huge duct sitting in my cellar.  The worst part of their company (which is a tough thing to determine) is their attitude and customer service, though.  My board got zapped by a storm last Friday and was without AC over the weekend (this is early August, some of the hottest days of the year).  I tried calling them probably 8 times.  They have an answering service.  Every time I called the operator said they have been in touch with them, and that they would call me right back.  Of course, nothing.  The next Monday morning I start calling again and they would pickup the phone and then hang up.  Thought it was a mistake but I called multiple times and heard them pickup and then hang up.  Eventually I emailed Jay Douglas, and he said I should contact the salesman from the prior company to get it fixed.  What?  They don’t exist and they bought the customer book (me).  What a coward.  Their work sucks.  Their attitude sucks.  And they will make you miserable if you become a customer.  Can’t recommend that you run as fast as you can, like I am, away from this company.

I would recommend Douglas Heating and Air to my mother.

The first thing to say is that my job wasn't easy. It required fitting a new system into older duct work, getting up to code, and off site fabrication of fitting pieces. Plus, I needed both heating and cooling. So, this job was not an easy one.

With all that said, Douglas exceeded my expectations. Scheduling began the job, and the guy I talked to worked with me to find a date that would work around my homeschool schedule and my wife's work - no easy arrangement in itself. Then, the sales rep arrived to look at my system. The arrangement was just to look at what was going on, and the salesman walked in took one glance at the situation, and said, "So, we're replacing this, right?" I had a ton of questions given such a quick response. The salesman with a patience that defies reason explained each section not up to code, the problems seen with the heating, and the failures of the cooling. Every detail was pointed out to me. That's a level of professionalism that I haven't encountered.

At long last the replacement job arrives, a two man crew arrived at my house. They, initially, went through the steps of seeing where the job was and getting access. Then, the lead guy took the time to explain to me what the plan was. For example, the air conditioner would happen at this point; the heater at that point, and you may expect this, that, and the other thing during the process. As a result, I could handle the kids with the loud noises. Even after they completed the work [no small feat as I said], they showed me the results of what they did. The lead took me to each connection, showed me the outcome of the off site fabrications, and explained to me how the new thermostat worked - gave me a complete tutorial.

So, if you're looking for someone to do the job with technical accuracy, you've found your crew. If you're looking for some value added as far as customer service and professionalism, then pick Douglas Heating & Air.

I recently came home to a burst water pipe that flooded our whole house late on Wednesday- After I got in touch with a water mitigation company who helped us out, I called Brown's & they got us a plumber out the next day (Thursday). I was told it was just for a diagnosis, and the following day would be likely be when the repairs could be done.
Malakai came out on time the day after, and immediately set to work finding the burst pipe - he told us the material was old & the pipe wasn't even insulated- the culprit being the external faucet for the back yard. Then he said he could literally start repairing right then and there! Malakai not only got parts very quickly, replaced the pipe with correct modern material piping, he insulated the whole pipe as far as the attic & installed a new shut off valve so we could drain the pipe for future winters. I am not a very handy guy, but Malakai was so easy to communicate with, explaining each step and option very courteously. He is honestly a credit to Brown's - who I already liked because I have a service contract with them- but after his amazing service I wouldn't recommend anybody else to look after your plumbing, heating & cooling. Thank you, Malakai!

He stands behind his work and his name.  He is so professional and seems to be a very honest and trustworthy person!  Brown's is grateful to have a highly skilled and professional team member. business_name: Doctor Cool Heating and Air Conditioning

reviews.text: I recently needed the services of an HVAC tech (on the coldest day of the year) and used the Dr Cool team for a third or fourth time.  Per usual I am extremely satisfied with the quality of work and customer service provided. They were skilled, timely, professional, and courteous. I would not hesitate to use their services again and again in the future. If you need reliability these guys are your answer. Thank you, Matt and the Dr Cool team!
he was on time & did the job quickly - reasonable price as well

Dr. Cool was very responsive when contacted about my aunt’s heat not working properly. I was concerned about getting someone to check it out during this period of severe cold but Matt scheduled someone for first thing the next morning.  He diagnosed the issue (heat pump sensor was bad and not switching to emergency gas heat when required) and suggested an innovative solution that improved the heating situation at a much lower cost than replacing the sensor. I can always trust Dr. Cool to be fast, honest and fair. Highly recommend!

Thank you and thanks to your guys, the new system seems way cooler than the old one already after a few hours and your guys were here all day in the rain, in and out of the house and we couldn’t even tell they had been here.  Y’all are awesome!
None

Matt was so helpful in getting someone to our home the same day we made our request. Chris, the technician, was friendly, knowledgeable and very professional.  Dr. Cool is now our HVAC company of choice!
My go to for gas; hvac; other repair. Never tries to sell unnecessary repairs, equipment, or services. Excellent work.

Matt returned my call immediately, since one out within just a few hours, and Chris had the parts on his truck that were needed to fix my AC. Incredible organization, and beautiful work! Highly, highly recommend them!
Great customer service. Techs who know what to do.  Thank you.

Dr. Cool came on an emergency call giving up his weekend to make sure we had heat. Technician was very professional, knowledgeable, and showed me what was wrong, explained what he was doing, and gave me tips on maintenance I needed to complete monthly.

A truly remarkable experience.  We woke up at 4am and the heat had gone out on one of the coldest nights of the year.  Ian and Dr. Cool had us back on by 8am.  And both kids and both parents got to school and work on time and not stressed in the least.  Ian immediately went to work, identified the problem (and another looming problem), fixed everything expertly, and tested my systems to make sure they were working.

Chris came to check my unit he was very professional arrived at the scheduled time took his time checking everything on the outside unit and inside. He run his tests  he didn't  find anything  wrong with it which is a good thing i was expecting  the compressor to be compromised . Will definitely use them again if we have a issue with it in the future.

Matt and his crew stepped in and saved the day after another HVAC company dropped the ball. Matt spotted the faulty units, broke it down for me, and sorted it all out. The guy's a communication wizard—always on the ball and totally transparent. Plus, he did extra work just because he's that awesome. In Birmingham? Don't even think twice; Matt's your HVAC hero.

Outstanding quality and service!  Can't recommend Matt and his team at Dr. Cool enough.  I've dealt with a handful of companies in the past with various problems but the responsiveness, quality of work, and price point are slim to none in comparison.  They running a clean operation there and will be exclusively using them moving forward!
They were able to send a technician on a day they were already busy, fix the problem, and had very reasonable rates. Very responsive to questions and great all around. Thanks guys!

Ian was absolutely wonderful and the best maintenance/service guy I’ve ever met. I recently bought this place, and my AC wasn’t working properly because there were a lot of issues. He diagnosed the problem easily, explained everything, and did fantastic work. I’ve never left a review for anything before, but he was so helpful and kind. Highly recommend!

Thank you Matt and the team at Doctor Cool for the QUICK response and efficient work in getting us back in the “cool”.  The technician fixed our problem and left no clean up behind. It’s a pleasure to work with Doctor Cool and I highly recommend them to anyone looking for HVAC help.
This was my second time using Dr. Cool and I couldn’t be more pleased with my experience.  They were extremely knowledgeable, had fair pricing and very prompt service. I would recommend 10/10!
My unit was replaced same day on a hot day! Professional and timely. Highly recommend
None

1st Class Service

Ian the service technician , diagnosed the issue and repaired the system . The air conditioner was repaired quickly and cooling the house within an hour .
Second time using Matt. Excellent service and trustworthy. Thanks again.

Doctor Cool has done previous work for us. This time Doctor Cool did a outside and inside system replacement. They took great care to keep things clean and were careful to not cause inside damage. On time with the right parts and ready to work. Thank You.
Great company with quality leadership. I have no reservations recommending this company.

BEWARE! DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!

Technicians arrived at my house to fix my A/C while I was at work. The technician braised a coil with no ventilation causing Carbon Monoxide to fill my home with pets inside! The alarm was going off and they left without even notifying me that it was going off. The carbon monoxide alarm sounded for an hour and a half before I realized it was going off by checking my house cameras and got my pets fresh air. Do not use these people! Completely unprofessional and will more than likely harm your loved ones!

Had a capacitor blow and Dr Cool was able to send someone out the same day. The technician arrived on time, was great about explaining what he was doing, and the pricing was fair. Will def use them again.
None
Very responsive - Super friendly.  Quickly came out on the weekend, and fixed the issue!  10/10

I cannot recommend Matt and his team at Dr Cool enough. Professional, responsive, and extremely knowledgeable. Matt came out to my house the day I reached out to them, and put in the work immediately. I had even prefaced that I figured we needed a new A/C unit entirely, but Matt quickly and honestly concluded that it wasn’t the case. Instead, he diagnosed a number of issues that I had never even considered - from cleaning my A/C unit, to ductwork repair, to maximizing airflow through the house. That kind of honesty and expertise in the service industry is as rare as it is appreciated. And he saved me some serious cash. Now, I’m typing this up from the cool comfort of my optimized HVAC just hours after the guys finished up. 10/10 Dr Cool will be my go-to for HVAC issues and maintenance moving forward.

My apartment complex used this company to fix the air conditioner in my unit. When they they finished there were ceiling pieces all over the kitchen floor, countertop, and in the eyes of the stove. Thankful for them fixing my air, but was not expecting to come home to a mess in my kitchen to clean up!

I had a problem with my condenser not working.   My wife called Doctor Cool in the morning and Matt came out that day just a couple of hours to look at it.   He immediately was able to find the issue.   The compressor had burned up.   He went inside to check the rest of the system and informed me that there was no need to replace the entire unit just the condenser.   He got me a quote that afternoon and was able to come out and install the next morning in less than an hour.   I highly recommend using as he is honest, professional,  and offers fair prices.  Will be using again for all my heating and air need.

Our AC stopped blowing cool air one evening last week, so the next morning we called Dr. Cool, who family members highly recommended. Chris was able to come to our house within an hour of our call, and he resolved the issue quickly (replaced the capacitor). Both Chris and Matt are extremely professional and friendly - we were thankful to have cool air again so quickly and will definitely call them in the future!

Chris was fabulous today! We had an issue with the AC yesterday evening, and after calling around 0830 this morning to request a work-in he arrived by 0930. Problem solved in under an hour. Doctor Cool came highly recommended by a friend in the construction business, and I can see why all reviews are 5 stars.

I suspected there was a leak in our water main between the house and the meter.  I heard water running through a pipe at the front of the house when all water was turned off in the house and the irrigation line was shut off.  Nate from OnTime showed up; and, we discussed the situation.  He went over the pricing if the fix were to a galvanized line leak or if the fix were to a copper line leak.  I had visions of my front shrub bed and lawn being torn up to find and fix the problem.  Nate allowed me to rake mulch away from the suspect site and to put a tarp out for him to put the dirt on that he dug out to find the leak.  He was very careful to do minimal damage to the shrubs as he dug the hole.  He found the leak very quickly about three feet down and quickly made the repair.  He had to angle his digging down to reach the leak in order to keep from removing shrubs that would have been obvious from the street.  When he finished filling back the hole, he raked the mulch back and you would have to look hard to even guess there was work done in the area.  My experience with plumbers in the past was just the opposite where they viewed their job as fix the problem, not to return it to great condition.  Nate cared about both fixing the problem and cleaning up the site with minimal invasion.  Thank you Nate!  Thank you OnTime for sending Nate!  Great job for a fair price!

When it was time to replace our HVAC and hot water heater the first quote we received (from another company) seemed unreasonably high. A neighbor highly recommended getting a quote from AGA HVAC  Services as they replaced the same systems for her the previous year.

AGA provided a detailed quote, very competitive pricing, and was happy to answer ALL of our questions. Thankfully, they were able to coordinate the install of both systems to take place on the same day. The entire team was professional, friendly, and did a great job.  Following the install, they were very helpful (and patient) in providing an A-Z overview of the new Nest smart thermostat. They also completed the online owner’s registration for the HVAC system which extended our warranty another 5 years.

Prior to leaving, the owner provided his cell number with instructions to call if we had any follow-up questions regarding the new smart thermostat rather than referring us to the owner’s manual. A week following the installation, the owner followed up to see if we had any questions or issues. This level of customer support is MUCH appreciated!

I don't think you can ask for a more important characteristic from an owner and his team than unfailing personal integrity. Face it, if we had the genuine skills to do the job ourselves, we'd already be up on the roof. Instead, we look for the people who do have the critical experience, we lend our trust to them, and we hope for the best. Sadly, we often find out too late that they lacked the knowledge, or even worse, they abused our trust.

We've been using Polar Bear exclusively for the past seven years at a somewhat older facility that's absolutely chock-full of "character", and never once have they steered us wrong. They've no doubt saved us tons just by preventing us from spending when we gladly would have.

Ever had the feeling that a heating & air vendor was just trying to sell you a load of expensive new equipment when the right investment would instead have been to fix what you had? Or, that maybe they were steering you towards a rushed decision when maybe thinking it through for a bit would have led to a much smarter and more economical outcome?

You'll never have those nagging feelings with the team at Polar Bear. William is a straight-shooter, and has said many times that he's not interested in just taking today's business, he wants to be a partner you can trust for the long-term. I can tell you sincerely, I have never once regretted taking his suggestions.

Choose them as your partners today- You'll be glad that you did.

My fiancé and I just recently bought a house. We called Polar Bear services to come out to check our ac unit because of something to do with our inspection. They said everything was fine. A week later, the temperature in the house starts rising so we call them out to look at it again. First, they told us they’d be out in a few hours since no one was home at the time. They call my fiancé back a couple minutes later and say they are at the house waiting on us and he proceeds to tell the guy he told someone on the phone no one was there for at least another hour. The service guy got angry with us because of poor communication within the company. Then, the service guy proceeds to tell me it’s because the unit “might” be low on Freon. He never looked at the system in the basement, just outside so I don’t know how he got an accurate solution.  He charged us for the most expensive Freon (he only used 1 lb) and $99 for less than an hour of service. Needless to say, it was a complete waste of time and money because the problem was ongoing and we had another company come out a few days later. That company was able to tell us the problem right away which the other guy would have, maybe, known had he looked at the system in the basement. Needless to say, the Polar Bear services guy didn’t seem to know what he was doing but had no problem charging an unnecessary, large amount of money. We will not be using this company again.

$3850 + $79.99 wasted!!!!! Our AC stopped working and we were advised we need a coil and condensor replaced. The fee for that was $3850. A month later the ac went back to blowing hot air. We called for PB to come back out and the technician stated a part was loose and needed to be replaced from the first service job and we would not be charged. That fixed it for about another month or two. The next technician stated a frog short circuited the system and he removed it and the ac went back to blowing like it should for another couple weeks. Every visit after the alleged frog incident has been one excuse after the other. We're doing renovations and were told the filters needed to be changed more frequently and the house would cool down. We continued to change them weekly and still no luck. We called yet again to advise of the continuing problem only to be charged $79.99 for them to clean the coils and blame the filters. The AC still continued to blow hot air and then the attic began to leak. So ANOTHER call was made. The technician stated the coils were frozen and that the ac needed to be turned off and to change the filter again (at this point we're already changing it weekly and have completed the renovations). The house still didnt cool down and the ac was still leaking. Another call was made the same day (as a leaking attic is urgent and ruining the ceiling) the technician returned and said the coil was shooting out water (ya think!!!! That's why we called in the first place!) had they bothered to look and not blame it on the filter they would have discovered it on the first visit. So the technician fixes the leak and says give it time, the house will cool. Guess what, it's still not cooling!!! So we wait a week (we work and can't keep taking off for someone to come out) and call them back out. The technician now states the roof doesnt have enough vents  and the attic door is off centered and that is what's causing the house not to cool. He said he tweaked something and give it a minute and it will cool. He also states he was advised to charge for coming out. What is there to charge for? The house is still hot, the temperature is steady rising as I type, and the original problem has not been fixed. They're basically grasping  at straws at this point and have run out of probable excuses.  Be prepared to throw away $4000 plus dollars and live in heat if you use this company. Currently in search of another AC company.

Our experience with Plus One Heating and Air began almost two years ago when our church needed two new 15-ton A/C units which were located in a third floor mechanical room that allowed no access for removing the old units and installing new ones without cutting a hole in either the roof or an exterior wall. Neither of those two options were preferred, so we contacted Plus One and asked if they could remove the existing units by disassembling them and installing new coils, motors, refrigerant piping, etc. in the old units' cabinets. As it turned out, earlier that year they had completed the same procedure on another job and felt very confident they could do the same for us.
We awarded them the contract and they immediately began taking exacting measurements of the existing units, which were sent to the manufacturers of our new units. It took only six weeks to have the old units completely disassembled, carried down three flights of stairs hauled away, have the old 15-ton condensing units removed, receive the new coils, condensing units, all of the piping reconfigured and soldered-in, and the units up and running in just under six weeks. We had not had to knock out any walls or roof structure, saving our church tens of thousands of dollars.

Since that installation we have had Plus One replace three more obsolete and non-working A/C units with almost flawless efficiency and at lower cost than any of the previous installations at our church.

Daniel has lead their teams of technicians on all of our jobs and every one of them are friendly, courteous and always helpful to me in my position as the church's Properties Committee Chairman.

Whoever you are and whatever A/C or Heating needs you have, I recommend you first call Plus One and give them the job. You wont regret it.

Eastside Baptist Church
Steve M. Thornton, Properties Committee

Edit: 1.5 yrs after paying $12k for a brand new heater and AC unit, I had an independent and highly rated company come do an annual checkup on the system. They found that the tape/mastic sealing the blower to the vents had detached and come up. (See pics.) They noted this was normal to see over time but abnormal for a system this young. I called TemperaturePro thinking this would be an easy fix. It's just tape. Didn't expect them to work for free but hoped they would work with me to make it right. I calmly explained the situation to Brooklyn, but she got oddly defensive, noting the labor warranty was now up and even at one point suggesting the new company could have pulled up the tape themselves. This was a huge turn-off. I expected they'd send someone out for an easy tape repair and stand behind their work. Instead, they tried to shift blame and make excuses. Then Brooklyn said she'd confer with the team and get back to me about a price for repairs. They never did. Very disappointing customer service for such a minor job after such a big expense. If they get this defensive and noncooperative over tape, I worry what else will go wrong with the system down the road.

Daniel was the first to respond to my inquiry on Angie.  He came out within 48 hours and provided me a fee consultation . My message on Angie's to any vendor that would respond was that I thought I might need a whole home dehumidifier.  Daniel ruled that out immediately even though all he had to do was roll with it because I was ready to purchase and install one.  He was adamant from the first visit that that was not the issue and that he had a set of items in order that we could start knocking out in a stairstep fashion to see improvement in our cooling issues that we were experiencing.    He also brought out the owner Sean a couple of times to make sure the prescription to the issues we were having cooling our upstairs was prioritized and addressed accordingly.  I have never had anyone in the service industry spend as much time needed to figure it out and to figure it our the right way.  I had lots of questions and challenged conventional thinking about what was needed and how it will all improve my situation and Daniel was patient through and was willing to explain/show how his approach would work.  After the first two items were completed we weren't seeing the numbers we wanted so they came back out to check over everything.  Made some adjustments and BOOM like a light switch the numbers fell in line.  All I can say is that my experience with Daniel, Sean and the TemperaturePro team was beyond excellent.  I will never have another company work on my units.  PERIOD!!! #customerforlife.  Thanks Daniel and Sean.  You all will crush your competitors with your honest and professional approach....keep it up.

And for a much better (and permanent)  repair solution too!! Daniel was honest about our issues, answered all of my questions and took the time to make sure I completely understood what was going on with our system. Over the years we’ve had a few different companies do maintenance and such on our system, but Daniel was the first person to mention a few different (very important) issues we have going on. He didn’t try to sell me anything, rather just educated and informed me. We in turn are using their company for the repairs and have signed up for their yearly maintenance. I appreciated Daniel’s professionalism, character, and personality very much!!! I felt totally comfortable and didn’t feel like they were trying to take advantage of me at all. What a stand up company!!! Great job Daniel!!!
